div.ab: From Ammonios son of Apollonios: from Nikias, I wish to lease for five years from the current [l. 5] 12th year for summer crops the land which was formerly held on lease by Bes, son of Nektheros, residing at Nesos Mesopotamia, the land consisting of 2 arouras near Senis and 1 aroura near Psingenisbthis, a total of 3 arouras or however many there may be [l. 10] in the 1st sector at a fixed rent. The rent for each of the two arouras near Senis, instead of the 16 drachmas previously paid, being 10 plus drachmas and that for the 1 aroura near Psingenisbthis being X drachmas. Nor shall I be compelled [l. 15] to pay more than the rent upon which we agreed. If anything happens or the land is unwatered in part, there shall be given to me a rebate as in similar cases, and after the contracted period I shall not [l. 20] be held to the same lease against my will. The 12th year of the Emperor Caesar Marcus Aurelius Antoninus Augustus Armeniacus Medicus Parthicus Maximus. Thoth 22. I, Ammonios son of Apollonios, submitted this application [l. 25] as aforesaid . . . Countersigned Peton son of Festos. 30th roll, column 12 . . . .
